qas.question: When were the Nieszawa statutes granted?
What did the Nieszawa statues clarify?

answers.text: the legal basis of voivodship sejmiks

qas.question: THe nobility was protected from what?
Why did the szlachta demand privileges?

answers.text: their participation in the Thirteen Years' War.

context: In <a0_0>1454<a0_0/> King Casimir IV granted the Nieszawa Statutes (Polish: "statuty cerkwicko-nieszawskie"), clarifying <a1_0>the legal basis of voivodship sejmiks<a1_0/> (local parliaments). The king could promulgate new laws, raise taxes, or call for a levée en masse (pospolite ruszenie) only with the consent of the sejmiks, and the nobility were protected from <a2_0>judicial abuses<a2_0/>. The Nieszawa Statutes also curbed the power of the <a3_0>magnates<a3_0/>, as the Sejm (national parliament) received the right to elect many officials, including judges, voivods and castellans. These privileges were demanded by the szlachta as a compensation for <a4_0>their participation in the Thirteen Years' War.
